result.execSummary:
All charges against Willie James Lott in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Willie James Lott is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie James Lott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie James Lott not in court, in custody. Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Willie James Lott.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Jury Trial.  State's witness is not available and the State is unable to proceed. Defense moves to dismiss the case. Court ordered case dismissed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, filed.
filed.
Defense Motion In Limine, filed.

Defendant Willie James Lott appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Willie James Lott.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Harris is moving to withdraw.  Court denied defense request to withdraw from the case.  Case remains scheduled for a jury trial on 10-17-22 at 8:30 am.
State's Notice of Video Recorded Statement, filed.
State's Motion In Limine, filed.
filed.
Reserving Right to Challenge Court's Jurisdiction, filed.
Demand for Speedy Trial from Defendant ( Willie Lott # 2022006734- Milwaukee County Jail 949 N 9th Street Milwaukee, WI 53233)

Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. 
Expires 10-17-22

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Willie James Lott not in court, in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court sets dates as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  The final pretrial will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Willie James Lott not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting a bail review hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 7-19-22 at 8:30 am for bail review.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM IN BR 10
Defendant Willie James Lott in court, appear by video with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris, appear by video.  Defendant Willie James Lott in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 10, Judge Havas. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 10. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring, with 24 hour curfew.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $50,000.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
All previous bail conditions are to remain the same.
Case is adjourned to 6-13-22 at 1:30 pm for preliminary hearing in Prelim Court.

Defendant Willie James Lott in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Willie James Lott in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court on State's motion to modify bail.  Arguments heard.  Court ordered $25,000.00 cash bail with GPS monitoring, with 24 hour curfew.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 6-16-22 at 1:30 pm is vacated. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie James Lott not in court, defendant in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called on the record on State's Emergency Motion to Modify bail.  Court ordered $1,000 PR bond ordered STAYED and bail is to revert back to cash bail amount on ADR. Defendant not to be released on $1,000.00 PR bond.  Case will be heard  in Br. 10 on 6-2-22 at 8:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of State's Objection to Bail set in ICCR and Request for Immediate Relief, filed.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ABT or her children.

Defendant Willie James Lott in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Willie James Lott in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie James Lott appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
